Some serpentfolk undergo intense ritual training and practice to improve their innate ability to disguise themselves. These serpentfolk often identify as members of a sinister society known as the Coils of Ydersius, and the most devoted of their number seek out methods of reincarnating into new forms to infiltrate enemy societies even more efficiently. Coil spies train in methods of infiltrating other societies to such an extent that they might be capable of infiltrating a mammalian civilization for years. Though they're expected to work entirely toward the eventual triumph of their people, most Coil spies also find personal pursuits. When Coil spies get caught, it's rarely due to a lack of skill, but rather to their arrogance or recklessness as they pursue their hedonistic desires. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 19 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 17 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 14 [Coil Spy](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3183) **Source** [Monster Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=221) pg. 304 1.1 **Perception** +10; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=74) ([imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412)) 30 feet **Languages** [Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Dwarven](/Languages.aspx?ID=3), [Gnomish](/Languages.aspx?ID=5), [Sakvroth](/Languages.aspx?ID=118); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=79) 100 feet **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +10, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +13, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +11, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +11, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) +10, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) +10, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +12, [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) +12 **Str** +2 **Dex** +4 **Con** +1 **Int** +4 **Wis** +2 **Cha** +5 **Items** [Hand Crossbow](/Weapons.aspx?ID=69) (20 bolts), [Spider Venom](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2906) (2), [Shortsword](/Weapons.aspx?ID=43), [Thieves' Toolkit](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2758) --- **AC** 22 **Fort** +9 **Ref** +12 **Will** +10 (+4 status vs. [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647)) +1 status to all saves vs. [magic](/Traits.aspx?ID=644) **HP** 48 **Resistances** [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669) 5 **Thin of Blood** Zyss serpentfolk recover slowly from injuries. When they take physical damage from a critical hit, they gain 1d4 [persistent bleed damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29). They take a –2 circumstance penalty to flat checks to recover from persistent damage and saving throws against afflictions.
 --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** shortsword +14 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 1d6+5 piercing plus serpentfolk venom **Melee** fangs +14 ([Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179)), **Damage** 1d6+5 piercing plus serpentfolk venom **Ranged** hand crossbow +10 ([range increment 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 1](/Traits.aspx?ID=254)), **Damage** 1d6+3 piercing plus serpentfolk venom or spider venom **Occult Innate Spells** DC 21 - **1st** [Ventriloquism](/Spells.aspx?ID=356) (at will) - **2nd** [Blur](/Spells.aspx?ID=28) (self only; at will) - **3rd** [Illusory Disguise](/Spells.aspx?ID=159) (at will) - **4th** [Suggestion](/Spells.aspx?ID=315) **Deceptive Reposition** The Coil spy Strides up to half their Speed and attempts a [Feint](/Actions.aspx?ID=2390), in either order. **Maintain Disguise** A Coil spy can maintain an ongoing [_illusory disguise_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1568) as long as they are conscious without having to re-cast the spell; they need only Cast the Spell again to reassume their _illusory disguise_ if they wish to change their appearance or if the active spell is dispelled. Coil spies typically seek privacy when they need to sleep, as an ongoing _illusory disguise_ ends an hour after they fall unconscious. **Serpentfolk Venom** ([Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) **Saving Throw** DC 19 Fortitude; **Maximum Duration** 6 rounds; **Stage 1** 1d4 poison damage and [enfeebled 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=71) (1 round); **Stage 2** 2d4 poison damage and enfeebled 1 (1 round) **[Sneak Attack](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=34)** The Coil spy's Strikes deal an extra 2d6 precision damage to [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) creatures.
